element.name: End of EMS Cardiac Arrest Event
element.definition: The patient's outcome at the end of the EMS event.
element.v3Comment: This element is a component of the Utstein Cardiac Arrest Criteria as identified in the American Heart Association journal "Resuscitation" from 2004 entitled "Cardiac Arrest and Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation Outcome Reports". http://circ.ahajournals.org/cgi/content/full/110/21/3385
element.v3Changes: Added to better identify the outcome of EMS cardiac arrest patients.

asserts.assert: End of EMS Cardiac Arrest Event should only be recorded when Cardiac Arrest is "Yes...".
When End of EMS Cardiac Arrest Event has a Not Value (Not Applicable, Not Recorded, or Not Reporting), it should be empty.

When End of EMS Cardiac Arrest Event is empty, it should have a Not Value (Not Applicable, Not Recorded, or Not Reporting, if allowed for the element) or a Pertinent Negative (if allowed for the element), or it should be omitted (if the element is optional).
